intro: Deiregyne ramirezii, commonly known as the Ramirez's sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically in countries like Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
